text: Menippe (; Ancient Greek: Μενίππη) in Greek mythology may refer to the following women: * Menippe, one of the OceanidesHyginus. Fabulae * Menippe, one of the NereidsHesiod, Theogony 240 ff. * Menippe, daughter of Orion,Ovid, Metamorphoses, 13. 685 ff, Antoninus Liberalis, Metamorphoses, 25, Scholia on Homer, Iliad, 18. 486 see Menippe and Metioche * Menippe, a Thessalian naiad daughter of Peneus, mother of Phrastor by Pelasgus.Dionysius of Halicarnassus, Roman Antiquities 1.28.3 (citing Hellanicus, Phoronis) = Hellanicus fr. 4 Fowler, pp. 156-176. * Menippe, one of the Amazons. She fought in Aeetes' army against the troops of Perses.Valerius Flaccus, Argonautica, 6. 370-377 *Menippe, daughter of Thamyris and mother of Orpheus by Oeagrus.John Tzetzes. Chiliades, 1.12 line 306 == References == Category:Nereids Category:Children of Peneus Category:Amazons (Greek mythology) Category:Women in Greek mythology Category:Characters in Greek mythology Category:Naiads Category:Oceanids
title: Menippe (mythology)
